The use of actual headlines and verbiage: The expert verified that the viral meme used real headlines and verbiage from news coverage of Rush Limbaugh's death and Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi's death.
Comparison of news coverage: The expert confirmed that the meme aimed to compare the news coverage of these two deaths to highlight the alleged media bias against conservatives.
Authenticity of the excerpts: The expert found that the excerpts used in the meme were indeed pulled from real articles published by The Washington Post and HuffPost.
Subjectivity of media bias: The expert acknowledged that the meme's claim about media bias is subjective and that different news outlets may have covered the deaths differently, as demonstrated by the varied reporting on Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi's death by other publications.
